title: SMX Achieves CMMC 2.0 Level 2 Certification
summary: SMX announced it has achieved CMMC 2.0 Level 2 certification, demonstrating leadership in safeguarding CUI. Shows the market is moving: companies are certifying NOW, not waiting.

title: MathCraft Security (Leesburg, VA) Earns CMMC Level 2
summary: Local Leesburg company MathCraft Security Technologies earned CMMC 2.0 Level 2 certification. Direct local competitor activity in Capital Cyber's backyard.

title: Reuters: CMMC Rules Creating Barrier for Small DoD Suppliers
summary: Reuters reports small defense suppliers are rethinking military work due to high CMMC compliance costs. This is EXACTLY the pain point Capital Cyber and CGA solve. Perfect for marketing content.

title: SBA Roundtable on CMMC Small Business Impacts (March 12)
summary: SBA Office of Advocacy hosting virtual roundtable March 12, 1 PM ET on CMMC program impacts to small businesses. Opportunity to attend and/or create content around it.

title: AI-Powered Cyber Threats Targeting Small Businesses: Ransomware, Phishing, Voice Deepfakes
summary: New report on AI-powered threats hitting SMBs including ransomware, phishing, and voice deepfakes. Great newsletter/blog topic for Capital Cyber audience.

title: Virginia SBDC: Cybersecurity Essentials Webinar for Small Business Owners
summary: Virginia SBDC released a webinar on core cybersecurity risks for small businesses in 2026. Potential partnership or cross-promotion angle for CGA.

title: 2026 Is a Turning Point for MSP Cybersecurity
summary: MSSP Alert: attacks growing in scale and complexity. MSPs must move beyond alert forwarding to integrated, end-to-end response. Validates Capital Cyber's 'security-first' positioning.

title: PreVeil: Growing List of CMMC Contracts & Solicitations in 2026
summary: PreVeil tracking active DoD contracts requiring CMMC compliance including Air Force Space Command CSO. Shows expanding demand for CMMC-ready contractors.

title: 78% of Enterprises Plan to Increase Cyber Spending in 2026
summary: Help Net Security reports 78% of organizations plan to increase cybersecurity budgets in 2026. Market is growing. Use in proposals and sales conversations.

title: Howard Community College (MD) Gets $550K for Cybersecurity Workforce
summary: Howard Community College awarded state grants for cybersecurity and innovation. Potential CGA partnership for workforce development and grant awareness.
